website_summaries.verdict: A great design makes this fork one that works for people of all sizes and strengths.
pros: A steel shaft provides extra durability and strength
The angled handle reduces wrist strain and helps maintain a sturdy grip while creating excellent leverage
Although the handle is plastic, it has strength to keep up with a strong shaft

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy fork!
customer_reviews.text: Very good garden fork, bought to replace a "Martha Stewart" fork purchased from Kmart some 15+ years ago (its handle socket failed, due to some rust and heavy use). I like the longer-than-average handle that allows better leverage for lifting rocks from heavy clay soil, and for using as an alternative to a rototiller in tight spaces. This fork is fairly heavy, built to last. I think that the tines could be a little better, as a couple show some bending-maybe I've been too aggressive at prying out buried rocks. With a little care, I expect this fork to be the last one I'll need, going on 62 years of age. Would buy again (e.g., if somebody stole it!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: Long time gardener in his 60's broke his older D-Handle fork and ordered this one. This is like a Cadillac of garden tools, as most Fiskars products are. A great investment that should last me and perhaps the next generation of gardeners in my family when I finally hang up the tools.
customer_reviews.author: JAG

customer_reviews.title: Normal shovel is terrible. Snow shovel is a bit better but not ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to move 10 yards of leaf mulch. Every year I have become a bit smarter with mulch. Normal shovel is terrible. Snow shovel is a bit better but not much. 10 tine manure fork used last year was much improved but would cause clumping and need to constantly pull off stuck mulch. This garden fork seems sturdy and did a great job with the majority of the mulch. Combine this with scraping the driveway at the end with the manure fork was the perfect combo. Hopefully this will last many years as seems well made and steel was what I was after.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Mots

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a nice unit. Just got it. The listing title reads like it has a steel handle, it's not it's plastic. Title on listing should be fixed so it's clear.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: "Heavy duty" fork bent the very first time I used it. Tines are thin; a lifelong gardener friend said, "That's not a garden fork, it's a potato fork." He could bend the tines with his hands. (He's 74.) I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I'd give zero stars it that were an option.
customer_reviews.author: disgusted gardener

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THE TOOL! The ergo design and light weight is wonderful for my injured body to still work the land. It looks like it will last for years as well. I recommend this to everyone, especially those who love doing yard, garden work, and have injured back, knees, wrists; ie bodies!! You'll get healthier by keep moving and working!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Steel handle has spring to it
customer_reviews.text: I haven't handled a spading fork since I was a kid, and I really like the Fiskars. My wife & I have been double digging some garden plots, and this fork does a great job of loosening up our heavy clay subsoil. I've noticed while working it back & forth that the steel handle has some spring to it, which I count as a benefit. That way, you know to ease off the pressure so you don't snap it. The tines are thick, and the construction seems quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Mutton

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Fiskars Ergo D-handle Steel Garden Fork (47 Inch)
customer_reviews.text: Because I am a girl with a slight build I learned long ago that tools were my best friends when trying to do things beyond my strength level. This year yard work has become a favorite hobby and I quickly found out that I can't move mounds of mulch and top soil and clippings and leaves and vines, etc, without some help. This garden fork is my latest find and I couldn't be happier. It is well-made, it is lightweight, but at same time sturdy enough for moving the heaviest materials. The icing on the cake...worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Amazon since 1997

customer_reviews.title: Bent Tine in 90 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: After just two uses (about 90 minutes total) one tine was noticeably bent and the plastic sheath on the handle was fraying badly. The soil was a clay and had previously cultivated. No rocks or large roots were present. Considering how little I used the fork and its price I can't recommend this tool. Just not sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, versatile and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit early as I have only used this a few hours but I really like the feel of the tool and I am "cautiously optimistic". I have been through many digging forks and most would have already broken at this point. I use this fork for: turning soil. breaking clods, aerating soil and moving compost. Suggested improvement: Widen the top of the head where the gardener's feet go! Highly recommended pending any possible updates in the future.
customer_reviews.author: npecom

customer_reviews.title: The Forkin' Best
customer_reviews.text: You don't know how many of these garden forks I've destroyed. Our soil is heavy and I'm impatient. This unit is the first one I have confidence in so far.
customer_reviews.author: amphibiac

customer_reviews.title: Best pitchfork I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best pitchfork I've ever used. Left it outside many rainy nights, not a hint of rust after a few months. Seems quite strong, I've used it to pry rocks and bricks out of the ground when I probably shouldn't, but it didn't bend permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Tough Fork
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing cheaper forks and other garden tools, I now look for Fiskars. this fork is tough and not likely to break in my lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Petula

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Digging Potatoes!
customer_reviews.text: Very Pleased! My husband is 6'4" and I am 5'4" and we both used this to dig 2 rows of potatoes and it worked very well for us both. This is very well made and would highly recommend it. I would say I would buy it again but this one will last my lifetime so no need.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Fork
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, sturdy fork. The handle is longer than normal which is good for a bit of extra leverage when prying up big clods or clumps of roots. I'm saying this tool is worth the extra money over the less expensive forks. This fork has a lifetime guaranty. You probably won't need it, but it's nice to know.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: MIGHTY AND STRONG AND LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AN AMAZINGLY WELL MADE TOOL AND FAR BETTER THAN ANY OTHER I HAVE HAD. THE DESIGN, THE WORKMANSHIP, THE USEFULNESS.....LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Tabascoroni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome garden fork!
customer_reviews.text: Great garden tool, it is extremely strong and well made! Perfect for lifting plants out of the soil without damaging the roots. Also makes turning the compost much easier! After having destroyed many other garden forks, this one finally is strong enough to not bend, it is built to last! And it’s made in Poland!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: I garden from a seated position. Even without the advantage of weight and leverage, this fork did the job! Am very pleased with the construction and materials used.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!  Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. When it arrived I was so happy to see how well it was made! This is a tool I can see being used for years to come in my sons garden.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Silver

customer_reviews.title: Use it to spread a lot of mulch
customer_reviews.text: I use about 7 tons of pine bark and playground mulch a year and this tool makes both loading a wheel barrel and evenly spreading the mulch efficient which translates into easier!
customer_reviews.author: Susieq

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome little garden fork
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy but not so heavy that I find it fatiguing. Works great for bucking barkdust. One of my newest favorite tools.
customer_reviews.author: Happy1

customer_reviews.title: ... been around for a while and has a deservedly good reputation. Don't bang or throw the fork down ...
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars has been around for a while and has a deservedly good reputation. Don't bang or throw the fork down on a hard surface; it will vibrate as a large tuning fork.
customer_reviews.author: Spinoza

customer_reviews.title: This tool seems to be exactly as described by the seller.
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest, most heavy duty garden fork I have used. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Weber

customer_reviews.title: Well made and looks like it will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: Well made and looks like it will last a long time. Not too heavy and as not rusted when i forgot to put it in the shed and we had a down pour.. nice length and a lot of lift as this is the only one i have seen that has a bend in the frame to accommodate more lifting power and ease on the back
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to work with for hours!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve already bent a tine, so be more gentle than me, but it’s been great- I got so much more work done with this and now have a good garden!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Coppock

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy pitchfork
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and the handle is a good ergonomic shape so you don't get blisters too easily.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, love it
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well crafted should be the last pitchfork i ever buy
customer_reviews.author: Kenster lt1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked as intended. Had a little trouble at first, couldn't find the power button.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki V.

customer_reviews.title: Great harvesting tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for harvesting my potatoes! I’m 5’ 4” and can handle well. Quality build. Hope to use in harvesting my garlic next summer!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: The tines are sturdy and spread out perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pitchfork to do 40 yards of mulch. I have always been a fan of Fiskars products and this one did not let me down. The tines are sturdy and spread out perfectly. I was able to scoop and hold more than my father in law with his old wooden/steel fork. The slight curve to the handle is the real beauty of this tool. It doesn't look like it would make a difference, but use a straight D-handle and then switch to this and you'll see what I mean. The lifetime warranty is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Christohper B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: This garden fork do the JOB! Recommend it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! I was able to transport 3 yards of mulch by myself!! Very easy to work with. It makes my job very constable! Forget about the shovel! This garden fork do the job!
customer_reviews.author: Pleyoo, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I would like to re-order it. Good design and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I have not broken the handle or spokes ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have not broken the handle or spokes and it's been used on some rough ground. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gin

customer_reviews.title: Great Garden Fork
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing how the design of this fork makes the work so much easier. I had to experience it to believe it. Well worth the extra bucks. This looks like it will be a life time tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Good digging fork
customer_reviews.text: Good spading fork. Easy to prepare beds by turning over the soil. Not for use as a pitchfork.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: It’s very well made, but quite heavy to handle, making it a little clumsy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Very sturdy. Fiberglass handle should last my lifetime for my composting needs.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge and strong! Works in Georgia clay!
customer_reviews.author: Sungazelle

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this spade, it is comfortable in my hands and lightweight. I have tried others and they broke off at the handle.
customer_reviews.author: MBriggs

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Putting it through it's paces and holding up very well. My back loves the added handle length. Looking forward to the garlic harvest season this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Best Garden Fork I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the fork AND the handle is wonderful. It should last for several generations if taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Nutter

customer_reviews.title: Great garden fork.
customer_reviews.text: Great garden fork. I bent a tine, but only because I exerted way too much force prying a root.
customer_reviews.author: PJMS

customer_reviews.title: I have never owned a Fiskars product that wasn't built ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a Fiskars product that wasn't built very well and lasted years on end! This fork will be no exception...
customer_reviews.author: p.w.e.

customer_reviews.title: Great fork
customer_reviews.text: Love this fork! Tools make all the difference in gardening. This tool feels like i'll be using it for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lesoine

customer_reviews.title: This is a great garden tool with heavy duty construction and very easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great garden tool with heavy duty construction and very easy to use. Much less effort is required to dig than with standard garden forks. I wish the handle was the wider, 2-hand grip that Fiskars used to have.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dull, dull, dull, dull
customer_reviews.text: The handle is nice, the shaft is strong, and the design is good. Just used this to turn my garden and it worked well...once I fixed it. The tines are incredibly dull and rough. This makes penetration significantly harder than it should be. It took a half hour first with a rough hand file, then with a Dremel and sanding drum, to sharpen and smooth the tines. It now penetrates deeper and much easier. Deducting two stars for the low-quality casting. Many people who spend this much won't realize it could be much better or have the tools to make it so.
customer_reviews.author: GearGuy

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVE GARDEN TOOL
customer_reviews.text: I love this more than words can describe. A game changer for digging holes and slinging compost and mulch. I havent even touched my shovel yet. Edit: After 4 weeks of use, one of the tines bent.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaR

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics are excellent! Tool appears to be able to handle years ...
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomics are excellent! Tool appears to be able to handle years of hard use.
customer_reviews.author: motocephalic

customer_reviews.title: Best fork.
customer_reviews.text: The longer handle a bent shaft design make this fork stand above the rest. I couldn't find anything comparable in the local home improvement stores.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, well made short handled pitchfork
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, well made short handled pitchfork. I use this to turn my compost heap and I'm impressed with the quality and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Voyager57

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fork - strong, pivots well, does everything I need from it.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. Easily digs into my heavy clay loam, and works great for scooping up pine straw to move it around the garden. It's very well made, and the tines have withstood some very tough roots so far.
customer_reviews.author: DYB

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to turn my compost and it is so much easier than turning it with a shovel. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine G. Frankel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Look no further. This is the one My yard tools are all Fiskars
customer_reviews.author: Jahn Quattlebaum

customer_reviews.title: Needs a good sharpening.
customer_reviews.text: The points aren't sharp enough. It works OK in loose soil.
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: Strong and dependable, can tell this will last many years
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars is a by-word for quality, and that is certainly the case here. A strong and sleek gardening fork that will handle all compost duties with gusto.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Collins-Hall

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy fork for mulch or digging.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I bought it to use mostly for moving mulch. It's a bit heavy for that but I wanted a good garden fork for digging as well and this does both to my satisfaction. Much nicer than the ones I found at home and garden stores and I like Fiskars products so I'm happy. We have loam over soft-ish clay and it's gone though that like butter.
customer_reviews.author: dd3

customer_reviews.title: Solid.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great garden fork. Well made, and Fiskars really backs up their products. If something goes wrong, they take care of it. When looking for a garden fork, I looked to see if they made one first. So glad they did.
customer_reviews.author: labdesigner

customer_reviews.title: A revolutionary pitchfork
customer_reviews.text: The next time you head to your local town hall meeting, you'll want this sturdy and solid pitchfork at your side to fight off all of the fracking oil lobbyists - it won't break and it won't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew West

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid product that looks like going to last. D-handle is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, and the extra length is an improvement over other readily available digging forks.
customer_reviews.author: C.Fiance

customer_reviews.title: Great digging fork!
customer_reviews.text: Love Fiskars garden tools. Definitely some of the best with an awesome warranty as well. Very sturdy and well built. This one is bit short for moving mulch or hay though.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: This Fiskars model is better built and stronger than than the $20 models at ...
customer_reviews.text: This Fiskars model is better built and stronger than than the $20 models at the big box stores. However, for this price, the tines should be a little heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Lamoni

customer_reviews.title: The garden fork for the rest of your life?
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but good quality, robust garden fork. I use it for turning manure/compost pile, and it's doing the job well with not a trace of rust or wear from being left out in a "hostile" environment.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW R BEAN

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed made otherwise rough chores easy size is perfect fit for my husband who's six-foot ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed made otherwise rough chores easy size is perfect fit for my husband who's six-foot tall no back breaking bending!! Made gardening enjoyable again
customer_reviews.author: Kcamer

customer_reviews.title: Superior
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. Will last forever. The ergonomic feature really helps with my arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.author: Cooch

customer_reviews.title: Best garden fork I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know a pitchfork could be so lightweight! Must be the aluminum! Best garden fork I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Klopot

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Strong - with lifetime warranty. Would be nice in stainless steel, but we probably would not like the cost.
customer_reviews.author: hoosier1

customer_reviews.title: this one is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am over 6 feet tall adn had major back surgery several years ago...shorter spades could not used...this one is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Retired and Glad

customer_reviews.title: Great For Turning Compost.
customer_reviews.text: I use this fork to turn my compost bin contents. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It's a pitchfork. Lightweight, strong, easy to hold and handle. I use it for turning compost in my compost bin--works great. If you're looking for a garden fork, look no further. I expect this to last years.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK C FRANK

customer_reviews.title: D-Handle is not steel!
customer_reviews.text: While this is ok quality, the D-Handle is not steel. it's plastic! I would not buy this again! If it sounds too good to be true ...
customer_reviews.author: HGB1

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We love our Fiskers 47 inch long handled garden fork. It seems to be very sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline A. Steeley

customer_reviews.title: Love the item
customer_reviews.text: Love the item. Very durable and a good weight/balance. I wish I could get the company to respond to me about the warranty, though...
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie H.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Light weight but looks very well made, the test will come this summer
customer_reviews.author: glenda justice

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new product, but sent me one that was returned and had wear/scuffs.
customer_reviews.text: The product clearly already had been used. The plastic on the end of the handle was broken, and it was scuffed and marred all over. Too bad, since the product cost a premium price for a pitchfork. I kept it since I had destroyed the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Debra J.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. Leaps and bounds over cheaper junk
customer_reviews.text: I use these spade forks for lifting up the sod when I drive over it. I have a 35' class A with a weight close to 22,000 lbs. When I move it into the shelter in the back yard, it leaves deep ruts. I use the spade fork to pull the soil back level. My last spade fork failed as it broke. It's UNACCEPTABLE to have your tools break when using as designed. I'm a professional mechanic and have always bought Snap-On, Mac, Proto tools. In my opinion, this Fiskars product rates right up there with my other quality tools with some being other Fiskars products. So far I have NEVER been dissatisfied with a Fiskars product.
customer_reviews.author: MLee

product_meta.title: Fiskars Ergo D-handle Steel Garden Fork (47 Inch)
product_meta.description: The Ergo D-handle Steel Garden Fork offers an ergonomic design that makes mixing, turning, loosening and lifting loose materials like soil, compost or mulch easier than ever. The welded steel construction is far more durable than wood and won’t flex like fiberglass. An angled D-handle keeps your wrist in a neutral position to reduce strain, and pointed boron steel tines make penetrating hardened soil easy. A mid grip and teardrop-shaped shaft provide exceptional comfort and control. The powder-coated steel resists rust and offers easy cleaning and a hang hole allows for convenient storage in your shed or garage.
feature_bullets: Loosen, lift and turn garden materials with a durable garden fork featuring advanced ergonomics and a rugged build
Welded boron steel blade and steel shaft provide durability that far outlasts wood-handled tools and won’t flex like fiberglass
Angled D-handle keeps your wrist in a neutral position to reduce strain and provides a secure grip
Teardrop-shaped shaft fits the natural shape of your hand and includes a mid grip for exceptional comfort and control

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
